sections.name: Joon-seo
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Good
traits.text: Good effects often manipulate energy from good-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to evil divine servants or divine servants of evil deities. A creature with this trait is good in alignment.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

traits.name: Samsaran
traits.text: Blue-skinned people native to Zi Ha, who reincarnate upon death and recall pieces of their past lives.

traits.name: Disarm
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Disarm with the Athletics skill even if you don’t have a free hand. This uses the weapon’s reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls (if any) as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Disarm using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure. On a critical success, you still need a free hand if you want to take the item.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Nonlethal
traits.text: Attacks with this weapon are nonlethal, and are used to knock creatures unconscious instead of kill them. You can use a nonlethal weapon to make a lethal attack with a –2 circumstance penalty.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: This weapon can be used to attack enemies up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent enemies. For creatures with reach, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Trip
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Trip with the Athletics skill even if you don’t have a free hand. This uses the weapon’s reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Trip using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure.

traits.name: Concentrate
traits.text: An action with this trait requires a degree of mental concentration and discipline.

traits.name: Evocation
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the evocation school of magic, typically involving energy and elemental forces.

traits.name: Occult
traits.text:
This magic comes from the occult tradition, calling upon bizarre and ephemeral mysteries. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to occult magic.

traits.name: Sonic
traits.text: An effect with the sonic trait functions only if it makes sound, meaning it has no effect in an area of silence or in a vacuum. This is different from an auditory spell, which is effective only if the target can hear it. A sonic effect might deal sonic damage.
